summary: This document is an email chain from August 9-12, 2019, detailing logistical planning between FBI New York Rapid Deployment Team and FBI San Juan Division (St. Thomas/St. Croix) for the execution of a search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's private island in the Virgin Islands. It discusses coordination of personnel, vessel transport, parking, and briefing schedules.

persons.name: Chow
persons.context: Mentioned as being 'on at 0600' for a briefing, indicating a role in the operational planning or execution.

events.title: Epstein Island Search Planning
events.description: Active email coordination between FBI New York and San Juan divisions regarding final logistics for the upcoming search of Epstein's private island.

events.title: Planned Search Warrant Execution
events.description: The operational plan indicates a briefing at 7 AM and a meet-up for boat transport to the island at 8 AM in Red Hook, St. Thomas.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island in the Virgin Islands in August 2019.
The operation involved coordination between the FBI New York Rapid Deployment Team and the FBI San Juan Division (St. Thomas/St. Croix).
Logistical plans included using vessels from CBP (Customs and Border Protection), USCG (U.S. Coast Guard), and a private vessel named 'Sabrage' for infiltration.
Operational security was a concern, with agents noting that using the public ferry dock for pickups would 'draw a lot of attention.'
The email chain references a former employee of Epstein who might be willing to answer questions, indicating investigators were seeking insider information.
